column5: My Trusted Traveler Nexus card is due to expire in September and they want you to apply for renewal 3 months in advance. So a couple of weeks ago I went online and filled out all the info to get it renewed. The next day I received a notice saying it was approved and within a week I received my new card in the mail, couldn't have been easier. For crossing the US & Canadian border it's the best thing since sliced bread, many crossings have express lanes for folks who are part of the Program. Only issue is if someone in the vehicle doesn't have a card you can't use the express lanes. Have had more than one Border Agent say to me you should get all the guys in the vehicle to get a card then you wouldn't have to wait in these long lines. It's also nice to have at the airport, when going through security many airports have a separate line if you are a member of the program and it's much shorter and quicker. Donscs
What with all the talk about the border maybe, maybe being opened, it might be a good idea to check one's passport to assure it is still valid. 'Jis sayin'. Bill

To Bill's point.....how about your outdoors card and fishing license ? I'm going to have to get both of them if the border were to open. I know exactly where my fishing gear is though....LOL. PjShorthorn
Bill good thing you mentioned passport,I checked mine I'm just good for this year
just checked mine....expired!!!!! Hope I can get a quick turnaround before august!!!!
Expedited services is currently taking 4-6 weeks -- regular service is 10-12 weeks.

Good reminder, we have our passports now and are good but we were in the process of renewing when Covid hit and it took about 4 months to do the renewal. I have been dealing with another situation through an agency in Washington, DC that has been frustrating to no end. We are about 9 month in on this issue that should have taken about 4-6 weeks for approval. Some of those federal folks need a swift kick in the pants Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
It's never been a problem going to Canada but there are several Asian and European countries that will not let you in if your passport is within 6 months of expiring.
You might consider buying Bill a beer.
I resemble that remark. At least one!!!! Bill
Bill Thanks for the reminder. Just checked and I am still good.
